meta.note: Includes Swadesh words found in text + additional vocabulary. No inferred words.

entries.src_id: [derived: From 'frígor' (cite: 515) + '-ido'; restores Latin 'frigidus', regularizing the eroded Romance forms (frio/freddo) and aligning with international 'frigid/refrigerar']
[derived: Latin 'maritus' preferred over 'marido' (Source 1363 logic); preserves 't' for derivatives like 'marital']
[derived: Neo-Latin consensus (Sp. bastón, It. bastone); conforms to -on noun class]
[derived: Back-formation from 'herbívoro' (cite: 1034); restores Latin 'h' and 'b' consistent with 'haber' logic]
[derived: Late Latin 'gamba'; unites It. 'gamba' and Fr. 'jambe'; preferred over 'perna' (ham)]
[derived: Latin 'genu' chosen due to extreme Neo-Latin divergence (rodilla/joelho/ginocchio)]
[derived: Latin 'cinis/cineris' chosen to unify Neo-Latin forms and support 'incinerar']
[derived: Latin/Sp/It 'arena'; restores 'n' lost in Pt 'areia' (like 'luna' vs 'lua')]
[derived: Latin 'pulvis/pulveris' restored to support 'pulverizar'; prefers 'u' like text's 'pulmon']
[derived: Latin frequentative 'sputare' (It. sputare); root of international 'sputum'; simpler than Iberian 'cuspir'/'escupir']
[derived: Latin 'luna' restored to support derivatives 'lunar/lunático' and unify It/Sp 'luna' vs Pt 'lua' (analogous to 'arena' logic)]
[derived: Latin 'natare' restored to support international derivative 'natacion' and unify divergent Neo-Latin forms (nadar/nager/nuotare), consistent with 'facer' and 'poter' logic]
[derived: Latin 'morior' -> 'morir'; rejects artificial 'mortar'; stem 'mor-' attested in 'morte' (cite: 1388)]
[derived: Latin 'dexter' restored to support international derivative 'dexteritate' and preserve 'x' (consistent with 'nexo' and 'tractar'/'puncto' logic)]
[derived: From adjective 'curto' (short) found in text (cite: 512); preserves Latin 'u' consistent with 'currer' (cite: 530), avoiding the Romance vowel shift to 'cortar']
[derived: Back-formation from 'cadita' (fall) found in text; restores Latin 'd' (It. cadere) lost in Sp/Pt, consistent with derivatives like 'decadéncia' and 'accidente']
[derived: From 'impulso' (cite: 108) and 'expulsa' (cite: 327); standardizes divergent Romance forms (empujar/pousser) back to Latin 'impulsare']
[derived: Latin 'scabere' restored to unify divergent Neo-Latin (rascar/coçar/gratter) and support derivatives 'scabioso/scabroso'. Follows conjugation pattern of 'scriber' (cite: 316).]
[Page 222; restores Latin 'sedere', connecting regularly to 'sedentario' and 'session']
[derived: From noun 'odor' found in text (cite: 1447, 527); also supported by 'inodoro' (cite: 672). Regularizes Romance divergence (cheirar/oler/sentir) back to Latin 'odorare'.]
[derived: Unifies Pt/It 'fender(e)' and Fr 'fendre'; restores Latin 'f' from Sp 'hender', consistent with 'facer' vs 'hacer']

[derived: Back-formation from 'stricto' (cite: 660); restores Latin 'stringere' to explain the participle 'stricto', creating a regular series (stringer -> stricto -> strictura) consistent with 'traher/tracto' logic]

defs.notes: transitive (to cause to swell); use reflexive 'se tumefacer' for intransitive (to become swollen)

entries.src_id: [derived: Compound of 'tumor' + 'facer'. Drops 'sc' to align with international 'tumefaccion' (tumefaction), distinct from 'tumescencia' (tumescence).]
[derived: Back-formation from 'lavage' (washing) and 'lavatório' (washroom, literally bathroom) found in text; maintains universal Romance consensus (Pt/Sp/It 'lavare', Fr 'laver')]
[derived: Back-formation from international 'detergente' (cleansing agent); restores Latin 'tergere', connecting regularly to 'detersion' and 'absterger']
[derived: Back-formation from 'largura' (width) found in text; means 'wide', distinct from 'longo' (long)]
[derived: Universal Romance 'ténue/ténu'; restores Latin 'tenuis', supported by international derivatives 'attenuar' (to make thin)]
[derived: Latin 'rotundus' restored to explain international 'rotunda' and 'rotundidad', correcting the prefix-heavy Sp/Pt 'redondo']
